business.headline: 'Nobody can say...': Narayana Murthy on why 70-hour workweek isn't up for debateNarayana Murthy shared the time which he used to spend at his office and said, "I used to get to the office at 6:20 am and leave at 8:30 pm. I've done it for 40-odd years. That's a fact. So nobody can say that's wrong."

Sensex tumbles over 800 points. Is Trump 2.0 behind stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was trading 800.18 points lower at 76,281 at 11:12 am, while the NSE Nifty50 dipped 200 points to 23,144.75.

Explained: Why Zomato shares are down 10% and what investors should doZomato shares were trading 9.42% lower at Rs 218.25 at 10:22 am. Shares of the food delivery giant had also declined in the previous session.

Stocks to watch today: Tata Technologies, Waaree Renewable, Reliance PowerAmid all the news regarding Donald Trump's tariff threat, several stocks such as Tata Technologies, Waaree Renewable, L&T Finance, Reliance Power, Vedanta will be in the spotlight today.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT and FMCG stocks drive early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 98.36 points to 77,171.80, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.20 points to 23,413.95 as of 9:30 AM.

Stallion India IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing dateStallion India IPO allotment status: Investors who have subscribed to Stallion India IPO can check their allotment status on the online portals of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.

Want to avoid paying credit card annual fees? Here are 3 easy tipsSometimes banks may waive your annual fees as a goodwill gesture, if you are a loyal customer with a good credit history.

Global elites' wealth grew 3x faster in 2024; 4 new billionaires weekly: OxfamOxfam International, in its latest assessment of global inequality timed to the opening of the World Economic Forum meeting, also predicts at least five trillionaires will crop up over the next decade. A year ago, the group forecast that only one trillionaire would appear during that time.
Budget 2025: How can government make healthcare more affordableThe healthcare sector expects lowered costs on medical equipment in Budget 2025, thereby boosting affordability and accessibility.

Sensex, Nifty rally as banking stocks power markets higher; Zomato falls 7%Share Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex gained 454.11 points to close at 77,073.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 141.55 points to end at 23,344.75.

Zomato shares decline 7% as Q3 profit tumbles over 57%Zomato Stock Price: Soon after the Q3 results were released, Zomato shares sharply declined over 7%, hitting a day's low of Rs 228.80. At market closing, the food delivery giant's shares fell 3.14% to Rs 240.95.

Budget 2025: New income tax bill likely to be introduced for simpler taxationThe bill will be introduced directly in Parliament, wherein stakeholder inputs including taxpayers and experts, would be incorporated, before being finalised.

Ian Bremmer sheds light on impact of Trump's second term In an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Ian Bremmer shared his insights on the implications of Donald Trump's second term for the US, India and the world.
Rallis India share price falls 8% after Q3 results. Should you sell or hold?Shares of Rallis India were down 8% in early trade and were down 6.82% to Rs 269.85 at around 1:56 pm.
Ian Bremmer calls Elon Musk the most powerful man after Donald Trump in USIan Bremmer responded with a yes when asked if Musk is right now the most powerful man in the US after Donald Trump.

Faster PF transfers, direct online claims: Check benefits of new EPFO rulesThe newly introduced measures are expected to minimise the turnaround time, thereby benefiting about 94% of the 13 million claims filed during FY 2024-25.

Sensex jumps 600 points. Why is stock market rising today?Stock market today: While volatility on Dalal Street rose during the trading session, gains in major shares such as Kotak Mahindra Bank, Wipro, Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, SBI and Reliance Industries contributed to the market gains.

Paytm Q3 FY25 results: Revenue surges to Rs 1,828 crore, gets closer to profitabilityThe growth was propelled by the company's robust payments business and an expanding portfolio in financial services distribution.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 16 Naxals killed in Chhattisgarh encounter, one carried reward of Rs 1 croreThe interstate forces, acting on intelligence inputs about many Naxalities operating in the deep forests in the border area, launched an operation on January 19.

Donald Trump moves to end birthright citizenship: How will it impact Indians?Donald Trump's executive order to end birthright citizenship aims to revoke automatic US citizenship for children born to non-citizen parents. Here's how it will impact Indians.

Why Vivek Ramaswamy won't serve in Trump's Department of Government EfficiencyWhen Donald Trump picked Vivek Ramaswamy and Elon Musk to lead DOGE in November, he exuded confidence in the duo and said they would contribute to his 'Save America' moment.

Narayana Murthy clarifies 70-hour workweek remark: It's not wrong but is a choiceNarayana Murthy clarified his 70-hour workweek remark, suggesting that it is a personal choice and not something that can be imposed on others.

Melania Trump makes stylish return as FLOTUS. A look at her inauguration fashionMelania Trump put forth a poised and graceful presence with her sartorial picks during Donald Trump's Inauguration Day ceremonies.

Scooby Doo bandages, red coat: JD Vance's daughter steals the showWith bandages on her fingers featuring the famous cartoon characters Scooby-Doo and Bluey, and dressed in a red cape coat, reminiscent of something straight out of Little Red Riding Hood, the new Vice President's three-year-old daughter, Mirabel stole the show.

Delhi BJP promises financial aid, free education to students in 2nd manifestoThe BJP unveiled its second manifesto for the Delhi elections on Tuesday. Key promises include financial assistance of Rs 15,000 for competitive exam aspirants and free education up to the postgraduate level, if voted to power in the national capital.

First pardoned January 6 rioters released from detention facility in WashingtonDonald Trump Swearing In Ceremony Live Updates: Donald Trump took oath as the 47th US President at the Capitol Rotunda in Washington DC on Monday (local time). The inauguration ceremony was shifted indoors because of freezing cold. Trump vowed to act swiftly after the ceremony, signing the first round of executive orders already prepared on immigration and border security. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar represented India at Trump's inauguration event. Follow India Today for all the latest updates.

Watch: Trump praises 'very tall' son Barron at oath event, crowd goes wild As Barron raised his hands in the air to acknowledge the cheering crowd, Trump said, "He knew the youth vote. We won the youth vote by 36 points."

Day 10 Live: Bopanna-Zhang in action vs Peers Gadecki, Zverev beats Paul Australian Open 2025, Day 10 Live Updates: Alexander Zverev advances to semi-finals after thrashing Tommy Paul in the 1st quarter-final. Earlier, Paula Badosa beat Coco Gauff in the first quarter-final of the women's singles at the Rod Laver Arena. Later in the day, Rohan Bopanna will be in action as we build up to the blockbuster Carlos Alcaraz vs Novak Djokovic clash.

Saif Ali Khan to be discharged from hospital shortlyActor Saif Ali Khan will be discharged from the hospital on January 21. He was hospitalised at Mumbai's Lilavati hospital after being stabbed during a burglary bid at his Bandra house.

Trump roasts Biden and Harris, uses swearing-in speech for revengeDonald Trump used his speech after his swearing-in ceremony to take apart the four years of the Joe Biden-Kamala Harris administration. Biden by then had granted pardons to all and sundry. So, the roast was the best revenge that Trump could take. The toughest for the liberal leaders must have been Trump attacking them over restrictions on free speech.

Watch: Trump, Melania dance as US First Couple at inaugural ball; Vances joinOn Monday night, the President and First Lady took to the dance floor as the US Marine Band played "Battle Hymn of the Republic". The Trumps then traded partners to dance with the uniformed service members.

The crime drama, currently streaming on Prime Video, also stars Jaideep Ahlawat and Ishwak Singh.

Elon Musk's back-to-back 'Nazi salutes' at Trump event sparks controversyOn Monday, the tech billionaire took to the stage at the Capital One Arena in Washington D.C., pumping his arms and screaming "yes" to a rousing crowd of Trump supporters.

Fishy business: Why penguin divorce rates have everyone flappingKnown for their monogamous mating behavior, penguins are now experiencing a rise in divorce rates as they abandon their partners in search of more suitable mates. But what is driving this shift, and what are the potential implications? New study explains.

Raids at Game Changer producer Dil Raju, Pushpa 2 filmmakers' officesThe Income Tax Department, on Tuesday, conducted searches at multiple locations linked to prominent filmmaker Dil Raju on charges of alleged tax evasion. Offices of Mythri Movie Makers, producers of 'Pushpa 2' were also raided.

Melbourne Blockbuster: All you need to know about Djokovic vs AlcarazNovak Djokovic, the 10-time Australian Open champion, is determined to prove a point to his naysayers after failing to win a Grand Slam last year. The Serb faces a significant challenge as early as the quarter-finals, where he will take on Carlos Alcaraz on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Alcaraz will be aiming for his first victory over Djokovic on hard courts.

Trump says he will tariff and tax foreign countries. Trouble for India?US President Donald Trump vowed to overhaul the country's trade system and would impose tariffs and taxes on foreign countries to protect Americans. But would Trump's tariff plans affect India, which he once called the "king of tariffs"?
Pics: Telugu actors Kiran Abbavaram, Rahasya Gorak announce pregnancyTelugu actors Kiran Abbavaram and Rahasya Gorak are expecting their first child. The two got married in August 2024.

Bhai, you're loved...: Sushant Singh Rajput's sister on his birth anniversaryThe late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's sister Shweta Singh Kirti honoured him on his birth anniversary with a heartfelt post on social media.
Days of our lives actor Francisco San Martin dies by suicide at 39TV actor Francisco San Martin, famed for his role in Days of Our Lives, has died by suicide.

sports.headline: After semis berth, Paula Badosa says she contemplated retiring onceAustralian Open 2025: Paula Badosa said that during her struggle with injuries, she contemplated retiring from tennis. Rishabh Pant takes cheeky dig at Punjab Kings after being named Lucknow captainIPL 2025: Rishabh Pant joked about Punjab Kings' big purse, saying he was scared they would bid for him. The wicketkeeper-batter was named Lucknow Super Giants captain on Monday, January 20.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
